title: Secure Authentication and Role-Based Access Control
summary: Develop a secure multi-factor authentication system with role-based access restrictions.
description: Create a robust authentication mechanism that supports multi-factor authentication (MFA), ensuring user sessions are secure through additional verification layers such as OTP, biometrics, or authenticator apps. Establish role-based access controls (RBAC) so users can only view or interact with functionalities appropriate to their authorization level. All authentication data and user sessions must be securely encrypted, logged, and compliant with financial data security standards such as PCI DSS and ISO 27001.

title: Responsive and Accessible User Experience
summary: Implement a modern, responsive interface accessible across desktop, tablet, and mobile.
description: Design and build a fully responsive user interface that adapts seamlessly across devices and screen resolutions while maintaining visual consistency and high performance. Incorporate accessibility best practices following WCAG 2.1 standards to ensure usability for all customers. Implement intuitive navigation, minimal-click task flows, and optimized in-page load times to deliver an efficient, frictionless user journey throughout the portal.

title: Personalized Customer Dashboard
summary: Provide a personalized dashboard displaying accounts, services, and eligible products.
description: Develop a personalized dashboard that dynamically showcases user-specific data, such as account summaries, service usage, and relevant product offers based on eligibility and profile attributes. The dashboard should reflect real-time updates and support easy navigation to key actions like submitting requests or accessing services. Data visualization components should be implemented for enhanced clarity, promoting an engaging and informative overview of the customer's banking relationship.

title: Account Opening and Service Modification Workflows
summary: Enable streamlined digital workflows for account openings and modifications.
description: Develop guided, multi-step workflows allowing users to open new accounts or request service modifications directly online. Include intelligent form pre-filling from existing data, validation techniques, and backend integration points for automation. Ensure that workflows minimize manual inputs and clicks, significantly improving process completion speed. Maintain audit tracking of all submitted requests and ensure that all critical actions are validated using secure transaction checks.

title: Application Drafts and Secure Document Uploads
summary: Allow users to save incomplete applications and upload their documents securely.
description: Introduce a draft-saving functionality that enables customers to store incomplete applications within their account for future completion without data loss. Implement a secure document upload system allowing users to submit required identity or verification documents directly through the portal. All uploaded content must be encrypted at rest and in transit while complying with document management and banking data retention standards.

title: Notifications and Real-Time Request Updates
summary: Provide real-time request status tracking and automated notifications via portal and email.
description: Implement a notification and status update system that gives customers real-time visibility into the processing stages of their submissions. Notifications for key milestones such as request received, under review, and completed must be delivered via both the portal and email. Include a secure message framework within the portal for communication between users and support representatives while logging status updates for audit consistency.

title: Core Banking System Integration
summary: Integrate portal functionalities seamlessly with the core banking system.
description: Develop secure integration interfaces using APIs or middleware to connect the self-service portal with the bankâ€™s core banking system. This integration should ensure data consistency across modules for account information, transactions, user profiles, and products. Transaction synchronization must be real-time with fail-safe mechanisms, ensuring none of the customer data is lost or duplicated due to network or system downtime.

title: Portal Database and Performance Management
summary: Implement a dedicated database for portal performance optimization and reliability.
description: Set up an independent database architecture for the portal that synchronizes effectively with the core banking system but operates autonomously for performance resilience. Apply indexing, partitioning, and caching strategies for high-speed data queries and transactions. Include performance monitoring tools, automated failover configurations, and alerting mechanisms to support scalability, uptime reliability, and effective load management.

title: Comprehensive Audit Trail and Interaction History
summary: Maintain a full audit history and interaction record for all portal activities.
description: Implement a secure, immutable audit trail capturing every customer interaction and system operation, including logins, requests, modifications, and document uploads. Provide customers with access to their request history while maintaining administrative audit logs for regulatory compliance. All recorded actions must contain timestamps, user identifiers, and relevant metadata stored securely to meet data governance and audit standards.
